title: Keira Knightley wants to play Coleen Rooney in film about infamous Rebekah Vardy spat
text:

Actress Keira Knightley has joked that she would be keen to play Coleen Rooney in a dramatisation about her furious spat with fellow WAG Rebekah Vardy.

The scandal rocked the nation as Coleen revealed on Twitter that she had created a elaborate sting operation to identify who was selling stories about her to the media.

She had planted false stories about herself on her Instagram , slowly changing her settings so that fewer and fewer people could see them.

(Image: Brett D. Cove / SplashNews.com)

By the end of her months long investigation, the stories were still being leaked to the press even though only one person was able to see them on Coleen's story.

This person, Coleen dramatically revealed, was Rebekah Vardy, wife of footballer Jamie Vardy and a good friend of Coleen's.

The saga broke the internet, and word even got round to Hollywood actress Keira, 34, who confessed she had heard about the story.

When asked by Heat magazine if she would like to play the part of Coleen in a film about the incident, Keira replied: "Done!"

(Image: Getty Images)

Rebekah has now sensationally denied the claims, saying she "doesn't need the money" and slamming Coleen for causing her stress when she is heavily pregnant.

In an interview with the Daily Mail , she claimed arguing with Coleen was like "arguing with a pigeon".

The WAG replayed how her confrontation went on the phone to Coleen.

(Image: LightRocket via Getty Images)

She said: "That would be like arguing with a pigeon. You can tell it that you are right and it is wrong, but it's still going to s*** in your hair."

The I'm A Celeb star lamented her friend had "completely annihilated" her in the public when she accused her Instagram account of being behind the leaked stories.

She went on: "I thought she was my friend but she completely annihilated me. She [Coleen] said: 'You know, I always really liked you, which makes it harder'."

(Image: Daily Mirror)

Emotional Rebekah told how she was bombarded with death threats following the leaked stories scandal.

Police attended the mansion where she lives with her husband Jamie and their children after the death threats.

The reality star admitted she broke down in tears when she was targeted by cruel online trolls.

(Image: Twitter)

She said: "I have been told that I should die, that my children should die, my unborn child should die.

"It would be unacceptable for anyone. I am tough, but this has made me cry. It is hard to explain how horrible it has been."

Rebekah claimed she has given her Instagram password out to a PR agency and an advertising agency over the years, which could explain why the stories leaked.
description: The actress playfully agreed to take on the part of Coleen if a film was to be made about the scandal
